intro: Persoonia × lucida var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved ghost gum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powder. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by nectar-feeding insects. It is a hardy, drought-tolerant shrub that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a valuable addition to native gardens and landscapes.
